intro: Rigiolepis linearifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters that bloom in late spring to early summer. Rigiolepis linearifolia thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
